description:
### 9.11 sine

Generate an audio signal made of a sine wave with amplitude 1/8.

The audio signal is bit-exact.

The filter accepts the following options:

**frequency, f**

    Set the carrier frequency. Default is 440 Hz. 

**beep_factor, b**

    Enable a periodic beep every second with frequency beep_factor times the carrier frequency. Default is 0, meaning the beep is disabled. 

**sample_rate, r**

    Specify the sample rate, default is 44100. 

**duration, d**

    Specify the duration of the generated audio stream. 

**samples_per_frame**

    Set the number of samples per output frame. The expression can contain the following constants: n The (sequential) number of the output audio frame, starting from 0. pts The PTS (Presentation TimeStamp) of the output audio frame, expressed in TB units. t The PTS of the output audio frame, expressed in seconds. TB The timebase of the output audio frames. Default is 1024.
name: sine

options.description: Set the carrier frequency. Default is 440 Hz.
options.name: frequency

options.description: Enable a periodic beep every second with frequency beep_factor times the carrier frequency. Default is 0, meaning the beep is disabled.
options.name: beep_factor

options.description: Specify the duration of the generated audio stream.
options.name: duration

options.description:
Set the number of samples per output frame.

The expression can contain the following constants:

n

The (sequential) number of the output audio frame, starting from 0.

pts

The PTS (Presentation TimeStamp) of the output audio frame, expressed in TB units.

t

The PTS of the output audio frame, expressed in seconds.

TB

The timebase of the output audio frames.

Default is 1024.
options.name: samples_per_frame
